title: nf-core/pixelator pipeline parameters
description: Pipeline for analysis of Molecular Pixelation assays

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/pixelator/usage#samplesheet-input).

input_basedir.description: Path to a local or remote directory that is the "current working directory" for relative paths defined in the input samplesheet

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

save_amplicon_reads.description: Save intermediate amplicon reads generated from the raw input reads.
save_amplicon_reads.help: By default, generated amplicon FastQ files will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set it to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

trim_front.description: Trim N bases from the front of the reads

trim_tail.description: Trim N bases from the tail of the reads

max_length.description: The maximum length of a read
max_length.help_text: Reads longer then given length will be trimmed to the given length. If you set this argument it will overrule the value from the chosen design

min_length.description: The minimum length (bases) of a read
min_length.help_text: Reads shorter then given length will be discarded. If you set this argument it will overrule the value from the chosen design.

max_n_bases.description: The maximum number of Ns allowed in a read
max_n_bases.help_text: The default value of 0 means any reads with N in it will be filtered out

avg_qual.description: Minimum avg. quality a read must have (0 will disable the filter)

remove_polyg.description: Remove PolyG sequences (length of 10 or more)

adapterqc_mismatches.description: The number of mismatches allowed (in percentage) [default: 0.1; 0.0<=x<=0.9]

save_qc_passed_reads.description: Save intermediate QC read files containing all reads that passed the filters.
save_qc_passed_reads.help: By default, filtered read FastQ files after QC will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set it to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

save_qc_failed_reads.description: Save intermediate QC read files containing all reads that failed the filters.
save_qc_failed_reads.help: By default, FastQ files with reads that failed QC will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

demux_mismatches.description: The number of mismatches allowed (as a fraction)

demux_min_length.description: The minimum length of the barcode that must overlap when matching
demux_min_length.help_text: If you set this argument it will overrule the value from the chosen design

save_demux_processed_reads.description: Save intermediate QC read files containing all reads that contain valid antibody barcodes.
save_demux_processed_reads.help: By default, FastQ files containing reads with valid antibody barcodes will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

save_demux_failed_reads.description: Save intermediate QC read files containing all reads that failed the filters.
save_demux_failed_reads.help: By default, FastQ files containing reads without valid antibody barcodes will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

markers_ignore.description: A list of comma separated antibodies to discard

algorithm.description: The algorithm to use for collapsing (adjacency will perform error correction using the number of mismatches given)

max_neighbours.description: The maximum number of neighbors to use when searching for similar sequences. This number depends on the sequence depth and the ratio of erroneous molecules expected. A high value can make the algorithm slower. This is only used when algorithm is set to 'adjacency'

collapse_mismatches.description: The number of mismatches allowed when collapsing (adjacency)

collapse_min_count.description: Discard molecules with with a count (reads) lower than this value

save_collapsed_reads.description: Save an intermediate parquet file containing collapsed read information.
save_collapsed_reads.help: By default, intermediate collapsed reads will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

multiplet_recovery.description: Activate the multiplet recovery using leiden community detection

graph_max_refinement_recursion_depth.description: The number of times a component can be broken down into smaller components during the multiplet recovery process.

graph_max_edges_to_split.description: Maximum number of edges between the produced components as a result of a component split operation during the multiplet recovery process.

graph_min_count.description: Discard edges (pixels) with a count (reads) lower than this, use 1 to disable

save_edgelist.description: Save an intermediate CSV file containing the unfiltered graph edge list.
save_edgelist.help: By default, the unfiltered edge list will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

min_size.description: The minimum size (pixels) a component/cell can have (disabled by default)

max_size.description: The maximum size (pixels) a component/cell can have (disabled by default)

dynamic_filter.description: Enable the estimation of dynamic size filters using a log-rank approach.
dynamic_filter.help_text:
Following options are available:
- both: estimates both minimum and maximum component size
- min: estimates the minimum component size (or uses {MINIMUM_N_EDGES_CELL_SIZE} edges, whichever is smallest)
- max: estimates the maximum component size.

Note that this cannot be set at the same time as `--min-size` or `--max-size`.

aggregate_calling.description: Enable aggregate calling, information on potential aggregates will be added to the output data

save_raw_component_metrics.description: Save the raw_component_metrics.csv file from the annotate stage.
save_raw_component_metrics.help: By default, the raw_component_metrics CSV file after annotate will not be saved to the results directory. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

save_annotate_dataset.description: Save the PXL dataset after the annotate stage.
save_annotate_dataset.help: By default, the PXL file after annotate will not be saved to the results directory unless `--skip_analysis` and `--skip_layout` is passed. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

compute_polarization.description: Compute polarization scores matrix (clusters by markers)

compute_colocalization.description: Compute colocalization scores (marker by marker) for each component

use_full_bipartite.description: Use the bipartite graph instead of the one-node projection when computing polarization, coabundance and colocalization scores

polarization_transformation.description: Which transformation to use for the antibody counts when calculating polarity scores.
polarization_transformation.help_text:
- `raw`: use the raw counts.
- `log1p`: use the log1p-transformed counts.

polarization_n_permutations.description: Set the number of permutations use to compute the empirical z- and p-values for the polarity score

polarization_min_marker_count.description: The minimum number of counts of a marker to calculate the polarity score in the component

colocalization_transformation.description: Select the type of transformation to use on the node by antibody counts matrix when computing colocalization

colocalization_neighbourhood_size.description: Select the size of the neighborhood to use when computing colocalization metrics on each component

colocalization_n_permutations.description: Set the number of permutations use to compute the empirical p-value for the colocalization score

colocalization_min_region_count.description: The minimum number of counts in a region for it to be considered valid for computing colocalization

colocalization_min_marker_count.description: The minimum number of counts in a component for it to be considered valid for computing colocalization

save_analysis_dataset.description: Save the PXL dataset after the analysis stage.
save_analysis_dataset.help: By default, the PXL dataset after the analysis stage will only be saved be saved when `--skip_layout` is passed. Specify this flag (or set to `true` in your config file) to copy these files to the results directory when complete.

no_node_marker_counts.description: Skip adding marker counts to the layout.

layout_algorithm.description: Select a layout algorithm to use. This can be specified as a comma separated list to compute multiple layouts. Possible values are: fruchterman_reingold, fruchterman_reingold_3d, kamada_kawai, kamada_kawai_3d, pmds, pmds_3d

global_config_options.title: Global options
global_config_options.description: Global configuration options specific to nf-core/pixelator.

pixelator_container.description: Override the container image reference to use for all steps using the `pixelator` command.
pixelator_container.help_text:
Use this to force the pipeline to use a different image version in all steps that use the pixelator command.
The pipeline is not guaranteed to work when using different pixelator versions.

save_all.help:
This option is equivalent to passing:
`--save_amplicon_reads --save_qc_passed_reads --save_qc_failed_reads --save_demux_processed_reads --save_demux_failed_reads --save_collapsed_reads --save_edgelist --save_annotate_dataset --save_analysis_dataset`

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.
